NAME: Glenfiddich - 12 Year Old - Caoran Reserve
DESCRIPTION: A 12 year old Glenfiddich with a twist - the malted barley is dried using peat to produce a more characterful, smoky flavour - its name “Caoran” is from the Gaelic for Peat Ember.  Although a resounding success since its launch, this is a discontinued bottling.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Allta - Private Edition No 10
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie have released Allta as 10th release as part of the Private Edition. Allta has been created with their own wild yeast.

NAME: Milk & Honey - Single Cask Whisky Show London 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Only the best PX sherry cask has been chosen for the finishing period and matured in the Tel Aviv sun and used in this expression for The Whisky Show London 2019. 
Initially matured in a bourbon cask, this dram has a very smooth and delicate finish.

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - 2001 Cask Strength - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on 28th June 2001 and subsequently bottled on 27th January 2016 in the Highland town of Brora. This dram was matured for 14 (very almost 15 years) and is a vatting of casks 307849 and 307850, both of which were refilled sherry casks.
Bottled at the cask strength of 54% ABV by Gordon & MacPhail for their

NAME: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony
DESCRIPTION: Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

NAME: Glenmorangie - 18 Year Old - Extremely Rare
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

NAME: Tomatin - 2009 French Oak #3435 for Aberdeen Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 2009 and matured in cask #3435, a french oak cask, bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop in 2019.  This is one of just 280 bottles.

NAME: Stagg Jr
DESCRIPTION: Recently added to The Buffalo Trace range is this 75cl Stagg Junior, Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey, bottled at is 64.2% ABV.

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.
 
This is bottle number 1029.

NAME: Grand Old Parr - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly rare bottling of Old Parr 12 Year Old.

NAME: Blanton's - Special Reserve Barrel #525 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 20 and barrel 525. 
This is bottle number 56.

NAME: Blanton's - Special Reserve Barrel #123
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date - 2020. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35 and barrel 123.  
This is bottle number 238.

NAME: Blanton's - Special Reserve Barrel #123
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date - 2020. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35 and barrel 123.  
This is bottle number 61.

NAME: Blanton's - Special Reserve Barrel #124
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date - 2020. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35 and barrel 124.  
This is bottle number 88.

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.
 
This is bottle number 607.

NAME: Lot No 40 - Rye Whisky - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
Lot 40 is crafted in small batches using rye grain in a single pot still, this bold expression spends years aging in oak barrels before being carefully selected by Master Blender for being bottled at cask strength. 
This is the 3rd Editon and there are only 5460 bottles.
This is bottle number 145.

NAME: Glen Scotia - 14 Year Old SMWS 93.120 - Cocoa and Coal
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Scotia produces some of the finest single malts in Scotland. It was founded in 1832 down in Campbeltown.
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
There are only 277 bottle of this 14 year old bottle of Glen Scotia. It was distilled on 31st January 2005 in a re-charred hogshead cask in Campbeltown before being bottled.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Tusail
DESCRIPTION: Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

NAME: Clynelish - 8 Year Old  SMWS 26.143 Sandals and Candles
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Highland malt is from Clynelish and was aged for 8 years prior to bottling. It was aged in SMWS cask No 26.143 and is one of 251 bottles.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 105 Cask Strength 1L
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 70cl Litre bottle of Glenfarclas 105 Cask Strength (60%) matured in sherry casks. 
This is an older release, presented in a tall black and gold tube.

NAME: Talisker - Distillery Exclusive - Isle of Skye
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition from Talisker, which was exclusively available at the distillery.  The single malt was first matured in refill oak casks, followed by specially charred American Oak hogsheads before finally maturing in old European Oak puncheons.
This is one of 6,000 bottles.

NAME: Talisker - Neist Point
DESCRIPTION: Named after a headland on Skye's westernmost shore, Talisker Neist Point stands out in the Talisker range, its lasting qualities set in stone by the supreme skill and flair by the malt master. Filled from casks from varying wood types and ages he selected the ones to make this range.

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.
 
This is bottle number 97.

NAME: Hazelburn - 13 Year Old - Oloroso Cask
DESCRIPTION: First released in April 2018, this is 13 Year old bottling Hazelburn was distilled in October 2004. Hazelburn is a triple distilled, completely unpeated single malt, produced at the Springbank Distillery, this bottling has been matured in oloroso casks. This is 1 of 9000 bottles.

NAME: Glenglassaugh - 8 Year Old - 2011 Rare Cask Release Nauticus 1st Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: This long-aged Glenglassaugh is part of the distillery’s Rare Cask Releases. Matured over 8 years and finished in the finest Sauternes Hogshead which was cask number 288. This cask was hand-selected by Master Distiller Rachel Barne and bottled in 2019. There were only 275 bottles released.

NAME: Glen Moray - 10 Year Old Old Particular Douglas Laing 2008
DESCRIPTION:
One of the most respected and highly acclaimed independent bottlers of Scotch Whisky there is, Douglas Laing & Co has been established since 1948.  The company is based in Glasgow and boasts a great selection of brands including its "Remarkable Regional Malts" range, encompassing The Epicurean, Timorous Beastie, Scallywag, Rock Island and Big Peat, as well as Old Particular, Provenance and Xtra Old Particular, which they collectively call their "Exceptional Single Casks".
This Glen Moray has been aged for 10 years and is one of only 596 bottles that was matured in a sherry puncheon. No colouring has been added to this beautiful dram that was distilled in 2008.

NAME: Ardbeg - Ardbeg Day Feis Ile 2012 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - Collectors Edition
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies. This is the special Collectors edition.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old #7144 Aberdeen Whisky Shop 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop, this single cask was matured in an Oloroso Sherry Puncheon #7144. Only 718 bottles were produced. 
This is bottle 718.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old #7144 Aberdeen Whisky Shop 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop, this single cask was matured in an Oloroso Sherry Puncheon #7144. Only 718 bottles were produced. 
Bottle 663.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 3D Moine Mhor
DESCRIPTION: Moine Mhor is Gaelic for 'big peat' - This is a vatting of 3 different peat levels from 3 diverse cellars over 3 distinct eras, thus the name '3D': Heavily peated 2001 Port Charlotte, moderately peated 1998 whisky and 1989 lightly peated Bruichladdich.  Thi bottling is the second edition of 3D "The Peat Proposal" but with more peat and higher strength.

NAME: Glenlivet - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

NAME: Glenlivet - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Waves
DESCRIPTION: This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old #7144 Aberdeen Whisky Shop 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop, this single cask was matured in an Oloroso Sherry Puncheon #7144. Only 718 bottles were produced. 
Bottle 661.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

NAME: Edradour - 10 Year Old - Decanter
DESCRIPTION:
This 10-Year-Old Edradour single Highland malt is presented in an attractive ceramic decanter.
Now owned by Signatory, this distillery used to hold the title of the smallest Single malt distillery in the world.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Fino Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle released by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex-bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

NAME: Jack Daniel's - Single Barrel Strength 17-5605
DESCRIPTION:
The Single Barrel Strength are carefully chosen from the upper floors of our barrelhouses, where the whisk(e)y develops a robustness of character through more interaction with our handmade toasted and charred, American oak barrels. Bottled at 64.5%, this whisk(e)y has subtle notes of caramel and spice, balanced with bright and fruit notes and sweet aromatics.
Rick L - 18 & barrel 17-5605

NAME: Scapa - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A long discontinued 12 Year Old from the Scapa Distillery in Orkney.  It was matured for 12 years in clifftop warehouses overlooking the beautiful waters of the Scapa Flow.

NAME: Mortlach - 16 Year Old Distiller's Dram 2.81
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we said this single malt from the BEAST of Dufftown has been distilled 2.81 times...well you better!! This dram takes its inspiration from the world-renowned and award-winning 1992 16-year-old release!
Mortlach utilises a complex distillation process unlike any other. Three Wash Stills and three spirit stills are all unique in shape, size and have been hand cut. 
They believe that for 70 years, Mortlach has been the best kept secret in Scotch whisky.

NAME: Macallan - Select Oak 1L
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Select Oak is part of Macallans Travel Retail Range - The 1824 Collection. This single malt whisky was aged in a broad and unique combination of five cask types.  It is a lighter style of Macallan with sweet notes of butterscotch and vanilla.

NAME: Bimber - Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION: This Bimber Re-charred oak bottling is from Batch 1 of Bimber small-batch releases.  Matured in re-charred, American Oak Casks,  this is one of just 5000 bottles produced at 51.9%.

NAME: Redbreast - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength - B2/19
DESCRIPTION: This is the second batch of Redbreast Cask Strength released in 2019. Bottled at 55.8%, this 12 year old single pot still Irish whisky was matured in Oak casks.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

NAME: Caol Ila - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is said to be a balanced 18 Year Old - time has tamed the peatiness, with the raw Islay character being tempered by a robust oak influence.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 19 Year Old - Finest Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Released for travel retail in 2017, Glenmorangie 19-Year-Old Finest Reserve was matured for 19 years in selected American white oak bourbon casks before it was bottled at 43% ABV.

NAME: Caol Ila - Cask Strength 55%
DESCRIPTION: The Caol Ila Cask Strength bottling run has been discontinued and it is such a pity because at cask strength it was more intense and packed its own punch.

NAME: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - Single Cask #2132 - The W Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The W Club.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in first fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #2132 and was bottled at the cask strength of 67% ABV.  With only 615 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 1988 Distillers Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1988 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SK.312

NAME: Macallan - Gold
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

NAME: Caol Ila - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is said to be a balanced 18 Year Old - time has tamed the peatiness, with the raw Islay character being tempered by a robust oak influence.

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.
 
This is bottle number 1280.

NAME: Glen Scotia - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled down in Campbelltown, this single malt from this single malt from Glen Scotia was matured in a first in refill bourbon barrels and refill American oak hogsheads.
It was then finished for 12 months in first fill Oloroso sherry casks.
It was introduced to the Glen Scotia range in 2017, this 18-year-old expression was awarded double gold at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2018.

NAME: Wolfburn - Christmas 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2018 Christmas release and bears the verse of "Winter Time" by Robert Louis Stevenson on the label.

NAME: Wolfburn - From the Stills – Summer 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Each season Wolfburn produces a limited-release bottle exclusively for visitors to the distillery and this Summer it was released online instead. 
From Wolfburn - 
" It’s the first time we have crafted a seasonal release from peated spirit, and we have wound the clock back to 2015 and chosen three of our oldest peated casks: two quarter casks and a fresh bourbon barrel, all of which makes it a “drop of joy in the hand and pure pleasure on the palate” – according to our brand ambassador Mark."

NAME: Bimber - Peated Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1750 bottles in the Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Ex-peated Quarter Casks to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 30th July 2020.
 
This is bottle number 837.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1981 Kildalton (5cl)
DESCRIPTION: This legendary Ardbeg was released in a time where the Islay distillery was experimenting with light and non-peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981. This 1981 version was bottled into miniature 5cl and is exceptionally rare and now highly collectable.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 2016 re-release of the discontinued Highland Park 15-Year-Old. Aged in sherry casks, it is said to be 'a fresh and enormously drinkable whisky' by John Hansell, Malt Advocate Magazine.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Quinta Ruban
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban is matured in bourbon casks before finishing in the finest Ruby Port casks from the "Quintas" or wine estates of Portugal. Ruban is Gaelic for Ruby.

NAME: Ardmore -  12 Year Old 1986 100th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This malt distillery was more used for blending malts such as Teachers. However, this bottling was distilled in 1986 and was matured for 12 years. It celebrates the 100th anniversary of the distillery.
1899-1999

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Douglas Laing line of Old Malt cask here with a lovely, well-aged, bottle of Highland Park.
It was distilled in September 1997 before being bottled at 16 years of age in December 2013.

NAME: Blanton's - Special Reserve Barrel #124
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35 and barrel 124.  
This is bottle number 91.

NAME: Bimber - London Whisky Sample Gift Set (6 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: This Bimber Whisky Sample Gift Set includes 6 x 5cl:

NAME: Bruichladdich - 12 Year Old - Second Edition
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old from Bruichladdich was created by Jim McEwan.  Fresh and subtle, with vanilla flavours from the Bourbon casks, fresh exotic fruit and a well-rounded maltiness.

NAME: Reservoir - That Boutique-y Bourbon Company - 2 Year Old Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
A bottling from the Reservoir Distillery by That Boutique-y boubon Company that , bottles all manner of incredible bourbons from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
This is batch 1 of their blended series. There is 963 bottles.
This is bottle number 31.

NAME: Glen Scotia - 14 Year Old - Campbeltown Festival 2020
DESCRIPTION: Bottled for the 2020 CampbeltownMalt Festival this 14 year old bottling of Glen Scotia is limited edition and has been finished in Tawny Port casks.

NAME: Benrinnes - 11 Year Old SMWS 36.176 - Raiders of the Lost Fridge
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
There are only 210 bottles of this 11 year old bottle of Benrinnes. It was distilled on 12th September 2008 in a refill ex-bourbon hogshead before being finished in a 2nd fill ex-red wine barrique.

NAME: Kilchoman - Am Bùrach
DESCRIPTION: Kilchoman's Am Bùrach - meaning "the mess" in Gaelic! Created when a Stillman mixed together some Machir Bay and Port Matured Kilchoman while vatting casks! The whisky was filled back into Bourbon barrels and eventually given a finishing period in ruby port casks creating an unintentionally tasty dram!

NAME: Glen Moray - Distillery Selection Peated Virgin Oak 2011
DESCRIPTION: A peated expression from the much loved Speyside distillery - Glen Moray. It was distilled and filled in 2011 and bottled in 2019.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

NAME: Bruichladdich - 15 Year Old -  Fifteen (Second Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.2 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

NAME: Auchroisk - 2010 St Margaret - Lot 1
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt has been selected by experts from a single cask. Distilled in 2010 and matured in a bourbon cask, it was reracked in a port cask. The oak cask left undisturbed at Colebrun Distillery traditional dunage warehouse. There is only 260 bottles.
St Margaret’s Church in Aberlour, on Speyside, is launching its own limited edition whisky to raise funds for the Church and to commemorate St Margaret.
The tasting notes show luscious fruits on the nose. Hearty Oak spice emerges to balance the initial sweetness, presenting a slowly drying, fruity finish with a hint of dried fruit and nut. 
The Whisky was going to be launched at the Speyside Festival in May, but this Festival was cancelled due to Covid-19 and is now available via The Grand Whisky Auction
This is bottle number 220.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

NAME: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.

NAME: Auchroisk - 2010 St Margaret - Lot 1
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt has been selected by experts from a single cask. Distilled in 2010 and matured in a bourbon cask, it was reracked in a port cask. The oak cask left undisturbed at Colebrun Distillery traditional dunage warehouse. There is only 260 bottles.
St Margaret’s Church in Aberlour, on Speyside, is launching its own limited edition whisky to raise funds for the Church and to commemorate St Margaret.
The tasting notes show luscious fruits on the nose. Hearty Oak spice emerges to balance the initial sweetness, presenting a slowly drying, fruity finish with a hint of dried fruit and nut. 
The Whisky was going to be launched at the Speyside Festival in May, but this Festival was cancelled due to Covid-19 and is now available via The Grand Whisky Auction
The bottle number is 222.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 18 Year Old - Extremely Rare
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

NAME: Auchroisk - 2010 St Margaret - Lot 1
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt has been selected by experts from a single cask. Distilled in 2010 and matured in a bourbon cask, it was reracked in a port cask. The oak cask left undisturbed at Colebrun Distillery traditional dunage warehouse. There is only 260 bottles.
St Margaret’s Church in Aberlour, on Speyside, is launching its own limited edition whisky to raise funds for the Church and to commemorate St Margaret.
The tasting notes show luscious fruits on the nose. Hearty Oak spice emerges to balance the initial sweetness, presenting a slowly drying, fruity finish with a hint of dried fruit and nut. 
The Whisky was going to be launched at the Speyside Festival in May, but this Festival was cancelled due to Covid-19 and is now available via The Grand Whisky Auction
The bottle number is 219.

NAME: Balvenie - 14 Year Old - Peated Triple Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in three most traditional casks types, this malt was aged for 14 years. This non-chill filtered, bottled at 48.3% ABV and launched exclusively to travel retail in June 2017.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

NAME: Scapa - 1993 - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: This a 1993 vintage Scapa selected, produced, matured and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

NAME: Caol Ila - Cask Strength 55%
DESCRIPTION: The Caol Ila Cask Strength bottling run has been discontinued and it is such a pity because at cask strength it was more intense and packed its own punch.

NAME: Bimber - Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
This Bimber Re-charred oak bottling is from Batch 1 of Bimber small-batch releases.  Matured in re-charred, American Oak Casks,  this is one of just 5000 bottles produced at 51.9%.
This is bottle number 3298.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - 5cl Mini
DESCRIPTION:
An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

NAME: Caol Ila - Cask Strength 55%
DESCRIPTION: The Caol Ila Cask Strength bottling run has been discontinued and it is such a pity because at cask strength it was more intense and packed its own punch.

NAME: Box - The Festival 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Festival 2018 only contained smoky whisky which had been matured for over 5 years in 200-litre bourbon barrels. Festival 2018 also has been finished in new American oak barrels.  This is one of 1000 bottles produced. 
 
This is bottle number 516.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Murray McDavid 14 Year Old 75cl
DESCRIPTION: The Bruichladdich distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid, around 2 years before this bottle was released. It is a 14 year old single cask containing whisky distilled in 1989. It was bottled in November 2003 from bourbon cask #MM1689

NAME: Wolfburn - Christmas 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2018 Christmas release and bears the verse of "Winter Time" by Robert Louis Stevenson on the label.

NAME: Macphail's - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Producing the finest 'Scotch Whisky' since 1895, this single malt is from an undisclosed distillery.
It has been matured for a minimum of 10 years.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 2010 MRC:01
DESCRIPTION: Bottled at 59.2% MRC:01 2010 was distilled from 100% Scottish barley, from the Invernesshire region. Matured in first-fill American whiskey casks and second fill French wine casks then matured for an extra year in the finest French oak from the Bordeaux left bank.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.2 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Jim Beam - 8 Year Old One Unified Company 1L
DESCRIPTION:
Ever since the prohibition, Jim Beam is the man we should be thanking for his tremendous vision to try and create some of the best bourbon in the world. 
This bottle was commissioned in January to celebrate the newly unified company.

NAME: Laphroaig - Brodir - Port Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION: Initially launched exclusively in global travel retail, Brodir is aged initially in ex-bourbon barrels, before being finished in European oak ex-ruby port casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - 40 Years of Orkney Rugby Club
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2006, this single malt from Orkney was specially bottled to celebrate 40 years of Orkney Rugby Club.
Distilled in Kirkwall, Highland Park is the most Northerly Scottish Single Malt Distillery in the World.

NAME: Project Renaissance - Dewar's (3x75cl)
DESCRIPTION: This lot contains 3x70cl:

NAME: Tomatin - 2009 French Oak #3435 for Aberdeen Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2009 and matured in cask #3435, a french oak cask, bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop in 2019.  This is one of just 280 bottles.
This is bottle number 135.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Bacalta
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie Bacalta is s a single malt that is the eight release from the Private Edition collection. Matured in ex-bourbon casks and extra matured in former malmsey maderia wine casks.

NAME: Tomatin - 2009 French Oak #3434 for Aberdeen Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2009 and matured in cask #3434, a french oak cask, bottled exclusively for Aberdeen Whisky Shop in 2019.  This is one of just 280 bottles.
This is bottle number 206.

NAME: Ardbeg - Corryvreckan
DESCRIPTION: This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

NAME: Craigellachie - 8 Year Old SMWS 44.116 Pirate Ship in a Storm
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside cracker has been aged for 8 years in a 2nd fill Butt / Ex oloroso. It was distilled on the 20th of April 2011 and has been given the title Pirate Ship in a Storm! This is one of 567 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition Macallan 12 year old was exclusively matured in sherry seasoned oak casks, from Jerez.  It comes in a metal presentation tin featuring an image of a barrel shot by Magnum photographer Alex Soth.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask matured in a mixture of European and American oak casks that have previously contained Sherry, as well as American oak casks which have contained Bourbon.  It comes presented in a limited edition tin.

NAME: Ardnamurchan - 2019 / AD Spirit Release No4
DESCRIPTION:
The 2014 release from Ardnamurchan where they have used an ex first fill sherry.
Although it cannot be called Whisky just quite yet it is given the name Spirit. 
Showing how the whisky world is moving with the times if you scan the VR code you will be hit with Blockchain technology. 
This release features 2 butts, 6 hogsheads and 21 octaves all from American and Spanish oak ex-sherry (Oloroso and PX). A limited release of just over 5000 bottles.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 9 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 9-year-old Glen Garioch, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter - this is one of just 313 produced.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 9 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 9-year-old Glen Garioch, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter - this is one of just 313 produced.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 9 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 9-year-old Glen Garioch, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter - this is one of just 313 produced.

NAME: Adelphi - 11 Year Old 2006 - Breath Of The Speyside
DESCRIPTION: A mysterious Speyside single cask whisky from Adelphi's Breath Of series.  Distilled in 2006,  it was matured for 11 years and was bottled in 2019. This is one of just only 518 bottles produced.

NAME: Buchanan's - Red Seal 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
A Diageo product with the blend No MR7Eo5 and bottled at 80 proof. 
James Buchanan was based in Glasgow.

NAME: Strathisla - 7 Year Old SMWS - 58.38 - In a Sunny Lemon Grove + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside 7 year old from Strahisla was bottled in 2019 after being distilled on 10th September 2012 into a 2nd fill ex bourbon barrel. There is only 244 bottles.

NAME: Benrinnes - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Benrinnes has always been known as a malt with great substance and it is said to be down to their triple distillation process. 
This bottling is part of the highly collectable series - Flora and Fauna. 
The distillery is on the Northern shoulder of Ben Rinnes (Mountain) and is 700ft above sea level.

NAME: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Highland Park - Full Volume
DESCRIPTION: Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old #3767 2007 UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Distilled 01.05.2007, this Glenallachie was laid to rest and mature for 12 years in a Maderia Hogshead #3767 and was bottled in Aug 2019. Only 291 bottles were available and it was bottled exclusively to the UK.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Springbank - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength 55.3% 2020
DESCRIPTION:
The latest edition released in 2020 on 7th of Feb comes this Springbank 12-year-old Cask Strength expression. It matured in 65% Bourbon barrels and 35% Sherry casks. 
Tasting Notes from the distillery itself @ cask strength of 55.3% are as follows -
Nose: Fresh floral notes, white and green wine gums, wood chippings, candied ginger and black liquorice.
Palate: Initially rich & malty; spiced biscuit and salted caramel shortcake with a beautiful oily and chewy mouthfeel. Salted pretzels, Iberico ham and classic Springbank smoke follow.
Finish: The smoke continues alongside sea salt dark chocolate, freshly ground coffee and lemon sherbet.

NAME: Highland Park - 25 Year Old 5cl & 18 Year Old 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 48.1% ABV.
Very nicely presented with a gentle smokey finish. 
Highland Park 18 Year Old - 5cl, 43% ABV.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 100th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

NAME: Springbank - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength 56.2% 2018
DESCRIPTION: The latest edition released in 2018 comes this Springbank 12-year-old Cask Strength expression. It matured in 65% Bourbon barrels and 35% Sherry casks, it was bottled at cask strength of 56.2% ABV.

NAME: Taylors - Vintage Port 1985
DESCRIPTION:
The Vintage of 1985 was preceded by an exceptionally cold, wet winter and a hot Summer - it was a year that resulted in Port wines of exceptional quality.  Produced in Portugal.
20.5% ABV

NAME: Arran - 10 Year Old - #985 - Whisky Broker
DESCRIPTION: This 2008 vintage Aaron single cask, matured in cask #985, was bottled  Whisky Broker in 2019 at the natural cask strength of 57.4%.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Peat
DESCRIPTION:
This bottles has been revamped and is now called Bruichladdich Peat. It used to be the much loved favourite Bruichladdich 3D.  
Higher than usual for this Islay distillery, its phenol content is at 35ppm.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Rocks - 1st Edition
DESCRIPTION: A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2007, this expression was the first edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007, with the final realise in 2011.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old #3767 2007 UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Distilled 01.05.2007, this Glenallachie was laid to rest and mature for 12 years in a Maderia Hogshead #3767 and was bottled in Aug 2019. Only 291 bottles were available and it was bottled exclusively to the UK. 
Bottle 90.

DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Glenallachie - 10 Year Old #586 2008 UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Specially selected for the UK this cask #586 has been aged for 10 years and was bottled in 2019. Only 283 bottles were produced.

NAME: Auchroisk - 2010 St Margaret - Lot 1
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt has been selected by experts from a single cask. Distilled in 2010 and matured in a bourbon cask, it was reracked in a port cask. The oak cask left undisturbed at Colebrun Distillery traditional dunage warehouse. There is only 260 bottles.

The Whisky was going to be launched at the Speyside Festival in May, but this Festival was cancelled due to Covid-19 and is now available via The Grand Whisky Auction
This is bottle number 260.

DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This is bottle number 221.

NAME: Glen Moray - 16 Year Old Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old Glen Moray celebrating the army regiment based in Perth, Scotland.
Becoming more collectable all the time, this Elgin classic has really stood the test of time!
Mellowed in Wine barrels.

NAME: Auchroisk - 2010 St Margaret - Lot 1
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt has been selected by experts from a single cask. Distilled in 2010 and matured in a bourbon cask, it was reracked in a port cask. The oak cask left undisturbed at Colebrun Distillery traditional dunage warehouse. There is only 260 bottles.

The Whisky was going to be launched at the Speyside Festival in May, but this Festival was cancelled due to Covid-19 and is now available via The Grand Whisky Auction
The bottle number is 223.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Pure Malt 1980's
DESCRIPTION: Released to celebrate the distilleries Centenary in 1987, this rare bottle Glenfiddich Pure Malt is becoming increasingly hard to find.  It includes a limited edition print.

NAME: Kilchoman - Loch Gorm 2014
DESCRIPTION:
Kilchoman's annual Loch Gorm releases brings together sherried fruit and peaty smoke brilliantly. This is the second edition, released in 2014.   
Fully matured from filling to bottling in fresh Oloroso sherry butts, The Loch Gorm expressions were the only all sherry cask-matured expression from Kilchoman.
The 2014 release was filled into fresh Oloroso sherry butts in 2009 and bottled in spring 2014.

NAME: Clynelish - 10 Year old 2008 Artist Collective LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was designed by artist Serge Le Fox and was distilled back in 2008. It was matured for 10 years in 9 refill bourbon barrels.
Clynelish has seen a resurgence in the last few years with the announcement of the reopening of Brora distillery on the horizon.
Comes with 2 branded glasses.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Artisan Cask
DESCRIPTION:
No Discontinued the Artisan Cask from Glenmorangie.
A first fill hogshead was used for maturation and it was made of Quercus Alba white oak from United States.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

NAME: Caol Ila - 1996 Distillers Edition (2009)
DESCRIPTION:
Caol Ila Distillers Edition was laid down in 1993 and subsequently bottled in 2006 after being matured in a Moscatel cask wood.
This edition has a deep, sweet and smoky flavour that suggests the intense, saturated colours of late afternoon sunshine after a storm has passed.
ID - C-si; 5-469

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Lion Rampant - Copper Shield Placque
DESCRIPTION:
This copper striking Lion Rampant copper Shield was handmade by a coppersmith. in Speyside.  An eye-catching addition to any whisky room.  Comes with premade holes to hang easily.
Approx dimensions:
16 inches x 15 inches 
Made using 3mm copper.

NAME: Alastair Cunningham's - 50 Years Blend - 75cl
DESCRIPTION: A special edition blended whisky from Hiram Walker to commemorate Alistair Cunningham's 50th year with the company in 1995. It's not a 50 year old whisky, but instead a blend of 50 malt whiskies and grain from Dumbarton.  This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old - Unpeated 2014
DESCRIPTION: While whisky from the Caol Ila is usually smoky, but this yearly release looks at the distillery's other, less well-known side: unpeated spirit. The 2014 bottling was matured in first-fill American oak casks.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - The Accord  (1L)
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old Glenmorangie showcases expertise in marrying casks. Matured in American oak bourbon casks and finished in oloroso sherry casks for sweetness and spice. Released for Travel retail.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Deanston - 14 Year Old - Spanish Oak
DESCRIPTION: A distillery exclusive release from Deanston Distillery.  It is finsihed in Spanish Oak casks and bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 10 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION:
A great distillery in one of the most beautiful parts of Scotland, Ben Nevis was built by "Long" John MacDonald in 1825.
This 70cl bottle was matured for 10 years.

NAME: Lagavulin - 8 Year Old - 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Taghta
DESCRIPTION:
Glenmorangie thoughts and the public opinion on this bottle is somewhat divided. It is an official 'crowd-sourced' whisky.
The whisky characteristics were decided by Glenmorangie's 'Cask Masters' and it was matured in ex-bourbon wood before being finished in Manzanilla casks.

NAME: Dalmore - 12 Year Old - Old Style - 1L
DESCRIPTION:
This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.

NAME: Ballantine's - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This Ballantine's 17-Year-Old bottling is from the 1990s.  Matured in oak casks and bottled by Ballantine & Son Limited distillers. This is a 75cl.

NAME: Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Mini Set 3 X 5cl
DESCRIPTION: Three Chivas Royal Salutes, in miniature Wade decanters. Ruby, Emerald and Sapphire.

NAME: Wolfburn - Mey Games 2020 50th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Holding the title as the most Northern distillery in the UK (until recently), this distillery is on the North Coast 500 in Thurso. If you have not been already, you really should make the effort. They are forward-thinking and couldn't possibly be more friendly! The first distillation from this distillery took place in Jan 2013 only 350m away from the previous site. 
Bottled for the 50th anniversary this is the 2020 release of the Mey Games and is one of only 200 bottles. Unfortunately, the global pandemic postponed this event.

NAME: Wolfburn - Bourbon - Highland Whisky Festival  2019
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2019 Highland Whisky Festival exclusive release which was celebrated for a week 10th - 17th of May 2019, this is a special release of bourbon aged single malt.

NAME: Highland Park - Full Volume
DESCRIPTION: Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Kaiyo - Whisky
DESCRIPTION: Kaiyo Whisky started out as a teaspooned malt. It's matured in mizunara oak, the casks then undergo a three-months at sea before bottling to encourage further flavour interactions.

NAME: Yamazaki - Distiller's Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

NAME: Springbank - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Still part of the core range down in Campletown.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 10...lovely, just lovely.

NAME: Craigellachie - 8 Year Old SMWS 44.116 Pirate Ship in a Storm
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside cracker has been aged for 8 years in a 2nd fill Butt / Ex oloroso. It was distilled on the 20th of April 2011 and has been given the title Pirate Ship in a Storm! This is one of 567 bottles.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 9 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 9-year-old Glen Garioch, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter - this is one of just 313 produced.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - 18 Year Old - The Centenary Blend
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend' by Sir Alexander Walker in 1920 to celebrate the centenary of the company founded by his grandfather John Walker in 1820.

NAME: Glengoyne - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old bottling of Glengoyne single malt is bottled at cask strength and has notes of vanilla and a heavy hit of spice.

NAME: Aberlour - A'Bunadh - Batch No.56
DESCRIPTION: Meaning 'of the origin' in Gaelic, A'bunadh is made in homage to Aberlour's founder, James Fleming.  This is batch No. 56 of the popular A'Bunadh single malt. It has been matured in Spanish Oloroso sherry butts and bottled at cask strength at 61.2% creating a dark luxurious whisky.

NAME: Miltonduff - 11 Year Old - Adelphi #3800735
DESCRIPTION: This Miltonduff was distilled in 2007. The single malt was matured in cask #3800735 for 11 years.  It was bottled by Adelphi in 2019.  A limited outturn of just 214 bottles were released at the cask strength of 61.2%.

NAME: Glen Ord - 10 Year Old Berry Bros 200 Aberdeen Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
Berry Bros has a history that is pretty spectacular...it has two royal warrants and 300+ years of history. Still trading from its original base and home - No3 St James Street London.
From the Highland distillery in Ross-shire, this dram has been drawn from cask #357 and was bottled in 2018. Aged for 10 years and is an exclusive for the Aberdeen Whisky Shop. Only 341 bottles were produced.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Waves
DESCRIPTION: This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - An Cladach (Limited Edition) 1L
DESCRIPTION: An Cladach by Bunnahabhain is a sherried expression. The name means 'The Shore' in Scots Gaelic which suits well due to Bunnahabhain's location on the north-east coast of Islay. This limited edition bottling was released for the Travel Retail market. This is a 1-litre bottling.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Aberlour - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Aberlour 16 Year Old was double matured in traditional oak casks and fine sherry casks. This double maturation has created a depth of character.

NAME: Macallan - Gold
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: This s and old-style bottling of the Macallan Sherry Oak 12-Year-Old which forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

NAME: Jack Daniel's - Bottled in Bond 100 Proof 1 Litre
DESCRIPTION:
For many people, this law would have gone unnoticed but The Bottled in Bond Act of 1897 is one which states that all spirits that have the words Bonded or bottled in Bond to have been produced
Since this rule came to fruition bond products are also required to be 100% proof by US standards.

NAME: Aberlour - A'Bunadh Batch 64
DESCRIPTION: Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 64. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

NAME: Bruichladdich - Islay Barley - 2006 Dunlossit Farm
DESCRIPTION: This bottling by Bruichladdich showcases the distillery's commitment to try and source as much barley as possible from Islay.  The 2006 vintage of Bruichladdich Islay Barley comes from Chalice barley grown on Dunlossit Farm; harvested in September 2006 and distilled November 2006.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Kingsbarns - 2015 Single Cask #1510360
DESCRIPTION: This single cask release from the lowland distilley, Kingsbarn was produced from a single American Oak Bourbon Barrel filled on 8th September 2015. Only 256 bottles were produced, all un-chill-filtered and at the natural cask strength of 60.9% when bottled in 2019.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Rocks 2nd Edition
DESCRIPTION: A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. This expression was the second edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007, with the final realise in 2011.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Craigellachie - 12 Year Old Whisky Broker #900680 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Found in the village of Aberlour, this distillery is found near the village of Craigellachie at the heart of Speyside. Translating it, it means rocky hill which refers to the cliff that looks over the river Spey.  The distillery was originally built and founded in 1891 by blenders/merchants. The following years were prosperous and ownership was transferred to a gentleman called Peter Mackie who in drove the distillery forward in 1916. Large amounts of the distilleries production is put forward to Dewar's blended whisky, however, their official bottlings are becoming much more prevalent.
This bottle was commissioned by Whiskybroker and was bottled 12.12.2019. Only 327 bottles were released from this single cask. It began its maturing journey in a bourbon barrel and then was transferred into an oloroso sherry hogshead. 
Bottle 80 of 327.

NAME: Craigellachie - 12 Year Old Whisky Broker #900680 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Found in the village of Aberlour, this distillery is found near the village of Craigellachie at the heart of Speyside. Translating it, it means rocky hill which refers to the cliff that looks over the river Spey.  The distillery was originally built and founded in 1891 by blenders/merchants. The following years were prosperous and ownership was transferred to a gentleman called Peter Mackie who in drove the distillery forward in 1916. Large amounts of the distilleries production is put forward to Dewar's blended whisky, however, their official bottlings are becoming much more prevalent.
This bottle was commissioned by Whiskybroker and was bottled 12.12.2019. Only 327 bottles were released from this single cask. It began its maturing journey in a bourbon barrel and then was transferred into an oloroso sherry hogshead. 
Bottle 84

NAME: Talisker - 2008 Distillers Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The Distillers Edition is a special release from Talisker, the single malt was double matured with a finishing period in a sweet amoroso cask-wood. 
The limited-edition bottle was distilled in 2008 and bottled at 45.8%.
The Distillers Edition Series features a small number of casks from 6 distilleries that were hand-selected for double maturing.

NAME: Ballantines - 17 Year Old - Allied Distillers 25th July Special Edition
DESCRIPTION: Ballantine's 17 year old is said the be the price of the Master blender. A special whisky with a smooth taste and round finish.  This limited edition Allied Distiller's bottling was given to staff members when the company was sold to Chivas Brothers in 25th July 2005.

NAME: Lagavulin - 8 Year Old - 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.2 is the second Bannow Island release by Waterford. Now 3 months older, this expression is from barley grown by Ed Harpur on the extreme southern coast of Co. Wexford, where salt-laden Atlantic winds and sandy soils create a unique, if challenging, terroir.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

NAME: Widow Jane - 4 Year Old La Maison du Whisky Bourbon 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
This is a limited edition bourbon that is made from ingredients New York State. They include -
It was bottled for La Maison du Whisky and is 4 years old.

NAME: Benrinnes - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Benrinnes has always been known as a malt with great substance and it is said to be down to their triple distillation process. 
This bottling is part of the highly collectable series - Flora and Fauna. 
The distillery is on the Northern shoulder of Ben Rinnes (Mountain) and is 700ft above sea level.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2018, Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old is a rich and smoky whisky made by the artisan minded Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known, is heavily peated to 40ppm as part of their journey to make the ultimate “Islay” Islay whisky.
The Port Charlotte 10 Year Old whisky is produced in tall, narrow-necked spirit stills. This creates a lot of reflux and maximizes the amount of copper contact that the vapour receives. The result is a smooth, silky whisky, with noticeable floral elements.  Following distillation, the new-make spirit is matured in a combination of first fill ex-bourbon casks (65%), second fill bourbon casks (10%) and second fill French wine casks from Bordeaux (25%).  The whisky is bottled on site. Neither chill filtering or caramel is used.

NAME: Macallan - Quest
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.2 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Astar (2017)
DESCRIPTION: This is Glenmorangie Astar was originally released in 2008 but was sadly discontinued in 2012 due to a lack of the very specific casks used to create it.  'Astar' is Gaelic for ‘journey’ - in reference to journey to perfection that Glenmorangie on in their search for the perfect casks to mature whisky.

NAME: Glen Moray - 8 Year Old - Octave 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years after being distilled in Speyside, this Glen Moray vintage is from 2009. Bottled in 2018 only 98 bottles were ever produced.
Bottled by Octave.

NAME: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony
DESCRIPTION: Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

NAME: Glenmorangie - The Tarlogan
DESCRIPTION:
Inspired by and named after the Tarlogie Spring, which has served as the sole water source for Glenmorangie since 1843. Its unique, mineral-rich waters lets them create their signature fragrant house style.
Aged in virgin oak as well as ex-bourbon casks, this single malt displays the sweet purity of the Tarlogie Spring.

NAME: Yamazaki - Distiller's Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

NAME: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony
DESCRIPTION: Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

NAME: Glen Moray - 8 Year Old - Octave 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years after being distilled in Speyside, this Glen Moray vintage is from 2009. Bottled in 2018 only 98 bottles were ever produced.
Bottled by Octave.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

NAME: Famous Grouse - 12 Year Old 1987 Vintage
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Famous Grouse Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This is bottling of Famous Grouse - 1987 Vintage, which was released following the success of the 1986 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

NAME: Black & White - Blended Whisky (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: Buchanan's Black & White blended whisky from the 1980s. This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Hanyu - Golden Horse (Musashi)
DESCRIPTION: Relaunched in 2016, Musashi is the pure malt expression from the Golden Horse range. Produced by Toashuzo, the revival of this legendary whisky was named after a famous Samurai warrior .
