NAME: Linkwood - 9 Year Old 2010 Infrequent Flyers
DESCRIPTION:
Based in Grangemouth, a gentleman called Alistair Walker established this company in 2018. He has years, 20 plus, of experience in the industry and decided to start his own Indy bottling line. This expression is part of the Infrequent Flyer range.
This bottling is one of only 275 bottles and was distilled in 2009 at Linkwood distillery. It matured beautifully in cask #306427 (Hogshead) before being bottled in 2019 at 9 years old.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - 18 Year Old - The Centenary Blend
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend' by Sir Alexander Walker in 1920 to celebrate the centenary of the company founded by his grandfather John Walker in 1820.

NAME: Balvenie - 14 Year Old - Caribbean Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This lot is the famous Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old single malt whisky. 
The Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old has been matured in traditional oak whisky casks for 14 years, and then finished in casks that previously held Caribbean rum.

NAME: Bladnoch - Distillery Exclusive - New Make
DESCRIPTION: A Distillery Exclusive single lowland malt.  It was distilled at Bladnoch, the most southerly distillery in Scotland.  Their official expressions are getting older due to the gap in stocks caused by the halt in production between 1993 and 2000 before the new owners came in and sorted the place out.

NAME: Orcadian - Blackadder Old Man of Hoy
DESCRIPTION:
Robin Tucek founded Blackadder in 1995 and was famous for being the co-author of the whisky book The Malt Whisky File: The Essential Guide for the Malt Whisky Connoisseur.
Robin chooses every bottle but it is a family-run business.
An Orcadian malt whisky aged in cask: 2002/HO7. Bottled at 43%.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 15 Year Old - Centenary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.  Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.
This limited edition was released in 1998 to mark the 100th Anniversary (Centenary) of Dalwhinnie distillery.

NAME: Tomatin - Inverness Airport 1995 Gordon & Machpail
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Highland single malt has been distilled at Tomatin distillery in 1995 and bottled in 2011 from cask #5128.

NAME: Arran - Robert Burns - World Federation - Limited Edition 2001
DESCRIPTION:
This 2001 bottling is limited edition from the Arran Distillery to mark the Patron of the Robert Burns World Federation Limited on the 25th January 2001. Registered number is 1763 which has been signed by the President J.H.Skilling and Chief Executive Shirley Bell. 
This bottle comes in a wooden presentation box with a certificate and a copy of the "Scotch Whisky" written by Burns himself.

NAME: Caol Ila - 8 Year Old - Lady of the Glen
DESCRIPTION:
Independent bottlers Hannah Whisky Merchants - Lady of the Glen from Scotland have chosen to bottle this Caol Ila, which was distilled on 31st May 2011 into a bourbon cask and and bottled 8 years later after being finished in a Amarone wine cask from Venera Botti, Veneto at cask strength of 57% on 23rd July 2019. This bottling came from cask #313406.
 
This is bottle number 154.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Eagle Rare - 10 Year Old 70cl Kentucky Straight Bourbon
DESCRIPTION:
From Kentucy, USA, this distillery has a long and very colourful history, claiming to be the oldest continuously-operating distillery in Northern America. 
Previous names include O.F.C and George T. Stagg.
This particular bottling is a 10 Year Old bourbon from Eagle Rare or as others may still refer to it as Buffalo Trace.

NAME: Wolfburn - Postponed Mey Games 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2020 Mey Games bottling which if it wasnt prosponed due to the current situtation in the world, it would have been the 50th Anniversary.

NAME: Dalmore - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

NAME: The Arran Malt - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This 12 Year Old Arran single malt is part of their core range. Bottled at natural cask strength of at 54.1% in September 2011. One of 12,000 and from batch Number 1

NAME: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

NAME: Bell's - 8 Year Old - Millennium Malt
DESCRIPTION: A special Millennium decanter of 8-year-old blended whisky from Bell's bottled for the Millennium in 2000 consisting of single malt and grain whiskies.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 12 Year Old - Second Edition
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old from Bruichladdich was created by Jim McEwan.  Fresh and subtle, with vanilla flavours from the Bourbon casks, fresh exotic fruit and a well-rounded maltiness.

NAME: Balvenie - 14 Year Old - Caribbean Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This lot is the famous Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old single malt whisky. 
The Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old has been matured in traditional oak whisky casks for 14 years, and then finished in casks that previously held Caribbean rum.

NAME: J.J. Corry - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION:
Chapel Gate whiskey bonder with Drinks by the Dram created this expression 'GAEL'.
Each bottling is a limited edition release and are made with a selection of single malts and married with grain whiskey.
This BAtch is limited to 7000 bottles and is a vatting of

NAME: Balvenie - 14 Year Old - Caribbean Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This lot is the famous Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old single malt whisky. 
The Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 year old has been matured in traditional oak whisky casks for 14 years, and then finished in casks that previously held Caribbean rum.

NAME: Glenlivet - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

NAME: Highland Park - Dark Origins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

NAME: Highland Park - Dark Origins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

NAME: Arran - 2004 - Bere Barley - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
The colour of this whisky is ripe golden barley. The barley used is bere which is Scotland's oldest cultivated barley. 
Bere for this Arran whisky was grown on Orkney before being malted in Inverness, subsequently distilled and of course, matured on Arran at the Distillery.
It has been matured for 8 years in American Oak barrels and bottled in 2012 at Cask Strength of 46%.
This is a limited edition total of 5800 bottles.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 15 Year Old - Distillery Edition (1L)
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Distillery Edition has been matured in traditional Oloroso sherry and bourbon casks before being married and ‘cut’ to 51% ABV.

NAME: The Archipelago - 2015
DESCRIPTION:
This is a special bottling for the Viking Line Whisky Fair, which was a huge success. This bottle could only be purchased onboard Viking Cinderella 2015 and caused chaos when it was released. Thanks to its quality and exclusivity, Archipelago has been talked about and in demand. Thought as a one-off event, it became an annual tradition.
After the success of the festival auction in 2014, we thought that one could do something similar to the Viking Line Whisky Fair 2015. This too is a very limited edition that can only be purchased on board Cinderella. It should of course be a unique bottling that stands out and maintains our high quality. The Archipelago is in the style of The Festival 2014, but with an unpeated distillate.
All casks underwent quality control before filling. No unpleasant scents were detected in addition to the expected vanilla and buttermilk.
Four 96 liter barrels of hard roasted new American oak were filled with 63.5% ABV unpeated spirit  05/12/2011.
Until October 2014, our casks have matured in a damp warehouse, where they lost slightly more alcohol than expected. Since October 2014 until bottling, the casks have been maturing in a dry environment in warehouse number 3.
07/01/2015 the whisky was moved to our blending tank and the strength was reduced with water to 54.8% ABV before bottling.
A total of 700 bottles were bottled to The Archipelago.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

NAME: Laphroaig - Triple Wood
DESCRIPTION: This is a 70 cl bottling of Laphroaig Triple wood.  It was originally launched for the duty-free market but the Triple Wood has become a core expression from Laphroaig.  The single malt has been triple matured; in bourbon barrels, quarter casks and then Oloroso sherry butts.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style) 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Glenmorangie - The Duthac - 1L
DESCRIPTION: Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

NAME: Highland Park - Saltire - Edition 2
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

NAME: Highland Park - Dark Origins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

NAME: Scapa - 2005 - Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2005
Bottled: 2017

NAME: Glendronach - 12 Year Old - Original
DESCRIPTION: Glendronach 12 Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.

NAME: Highland Park - Dark Origins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

NAME: Macallan - Quest
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.

NAME: Ardbeg  - An Oa
DESCRIPTION: 'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

NAME: Hunter Laing & Co - Scarabus - Specially Selected
DESCRIPTION:
Hunter Laing released their Scarabus, Specially Selected Islay single malt whisky durring the 2019 Feis Ile.  The bottle was available at the company’s recently opened Islay distillery, Ardnahoe.
Scarabus Specially Selected has been bottled at 46% alcohol by volume [92 proof] and is said to contain notes of rhubarb, Islay peat smoke and vanilla.
Scarabus, meaning ‘rocky place’ in Nordic, is named after a mystical area of Islay and is described as a whisky for those with a curious mind and an eye for detail.

NAME: Highland Park - Dark Origins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

NAME: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

NAME: Glenlivet - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Swing
DESCRIPTION: A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.

NAME: Highland Park - Leif Eriksson
DESCRIPTION: Launched in March 2010, for the travel retail market, Highland Park Leif Eriksson Limited Edition was released to celebrate the first European to reach America over a thousand years ago.  The single malt was matured in American oak casks, both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry in recognition of Leif Eriksson, a pioneering Viking explorer, as the first European man to set foot on American soil.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Glenmorangie - The Tayne - 1L
DESCRIPTION:
Another superb cask-finished whisky from Glenmorangie as part of their Legends range, this time using Amontillado sherry casks. This offering was previously only available at travel retail, though luckily a few bottles have made it onto our shelves. Glenmorangie the Tayne takes its inspiration from the legend of a Spanish man-o’-war ship that was wrecked off the coast close to the distillery. The whisky seeks to recreate the profile of a “Spanish treasure”. This whisky takes Glenmorangie’s classic floral, biscuity flavours, and adds another layer of sherried complexity. Amontillado is a type of sherry typified as being darker than Fino but lighter than Oloroso, with an excellent balance between the dry and sweet characteristics of both sherries.
It was, of course, immortalised by Edgar Allen Poe in his classic gothic short story, The Cask of Amontillado. There are no horror stories here however, with Glenmorangie the Tayne being a superb whisky, with excellent, sophisticated flavours of dry wine, almonds and honey. This whisky is bottled at 43%, and in a litre size.

NAME: Benromach - Cask Strength 2009 - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This 2009 vintage Benromach was bottled in 2019 after a decade maturing in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks. This delicately smoky dram is said to be replacing 100° Proof in the Bemromach Classic Range.

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.

NAME: Benromach - Sassicaia Wood Finish - 2019
DESCRIPTION: Benromach released the 2011 edition of its Sassicaia Wood Finish recently. Like the previous editions (2005, 2006,2007 and 2009) it was originally matured in first-fill bourbon barrels before being finished for just under 2 years in wine casks from the Bolgheri region in Tuscany, Italy.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 14 Year Old - Rich Oak
DESCRIPTION: After 14 years maturing in fine American oak casks, the Glenfiddich Malt Master carefully selected virgin Spanish and American oak casks to release extra layers of aroma and flavour.  This is said to be the first virgin American and European oak finished whisky in the world.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Swing Superior
DESCRIPTION: A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.

NAME: Uisge Teine - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in June 2003 this 16 year old was matured in a bourbon hogsgead #SE109 before being bottled in July 2019. There is only 196 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 52.

NAME: Glen Ord - 10 Year Old Berry Bros 200 Aberdeen Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
Berry Bros has a history that is pretty spectacular...it has two royal warrants and 300+ years of history. Still trading from its original base and home - No3 St James Street London.
From the Highland distillery in Ross-shire, this dram has been drawn from cask #357 and was bottled in 2018. Aged for 10 years and is an exclusive for the Aberdeen Whisky Shop. Only 341 bottles were produced.

NAME: Glen Scotia - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Glen Scotia 15 Year Old has been matured in the finest American Oak Barrels. This bottling was released in 2015.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Moine
DESCRIPTION: A peated expression from Bunnahabhain.  In Gaelic the word for “Peat” is Moine.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

NAME: Compass Box - Hedonism
DESCRIPTION:
A combination made from Scottish grain whiskies it has been aged in American Oak casks to mature and finish with bursting flavours. The whisky has been named Hedonism because of the pleasure, enjoyment, a celebration of that ideal marriage between distilled spirit and high quality oak maturation.
Compass Box is widely recognised as being hugely innovative with their methods and in doing so creating great whiskies.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Arran - Bodega Sherry Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This is the fresh new look for the Arran distillery during their makeover of the core range in 2019. 
To fully appreciate a whisky, it requires most of the senses and so much so these labels are complete with braille. 
This dram was aged in a 250L sherry hogshead and bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 7 Year Old 2012 Thompson Bros
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled at the foothills of the largest mountain in Scotland, this Highland single malt has been matured for 7 years prior to being bottled by the Thompson Bros.
Only 382 bottles were produced.

NAME: Caol Ila - 8 Year Old 2010 1800 Officer Mess Bottling No1
DESCRIPTION:
An independent bottling from Morrison & MacKay are relatively new to the scene. You may know some of their other bottlings such as the Old perth blends and Carn Mor range. 
This 8 Year Old Caol Ila was bottled in July 2018 as the 1880 Collection Officers Mess Bottling.
Cask No 314212 and 144 bottles were produced.

NAME: Singleton of Glen Ord - Distillery Exclusive - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 2019, distillery exclusive limited-edition bottling. This is one of 6000 bottles produced.

NAME: Glen Marnoch - 1988 Distiller's Reserve Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1988 and bottled in 2018 this is a Speyside single malt that is 30 years of age. 
Produced exclusively for Aldi.

NAME: Compass Box - The Peat Monster
DESCRIPTION: Perfect for those that love big, rich, peaty and smoky malt whiskies.  The Peat Monster combines very smoky malt whisky from Islay with medium-peated Highland whiskies to create a balanced but monstrous blend.

NAME: Kavalan - Original
DESCRIPTION: Aged entirely in Puncheon-type Sherry casks, Kavalan Original embodies the richness of the aromas and the mastery of the blend. It is expressed through elegant aromas of dried fruits, milk chocolate and honey. This expression perfectly combines the originality and innovation demonstrated by the Kavalan distillery for more than 10 years.

NAME: Glenglassaugh - Pedro Ximenez Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION:
The Wood Finishes series was launched late 2017 by the Glenglassaugh distillery.
This was the first time they've ever released cask-finished expressions. An exciting time for the distillery after a turbulent few years previous.
This bottling was aged in bourbon casks, to begin with and then moved over to Pedro Ximenéz for up to two years.

NAME: Highland Park - Saltire - Edition 2
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old - Warehouse Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This bottling was released to showcase the distillery's famous warehouse overlooking the Atlantic ocean.

NAME: Highland Park - Leif Eriksson
DESCRIPTION: Launched in March 2010, for the travel retail market, Highland Park Leif Eriksson Limited Edition was released to celebrate the first European to reach America over a thousand years ago.  The single malt was matured in American oak casks, both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry in recognition of Leif Eriksson, a pioneering Viking explorer, as the first European man to set foot on American soil.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with presentation tin tube.

NAME: Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage Matthew Gloag
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Famous Grouse Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.
Bottled in 2004.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old Giftset (with Corryvreckan & Uigeadale 5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This Ardbeg giftset includes: 
Ardbeg - 10 Year Old (70cl): Known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008. 70cl, 46%. 
Ardbeg - Corryvreckan (5cl): This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa. Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity. 57.1%.
Ardbeg - Uigeadail (5cl): This is the inaugural release of Uigeadail, bottled at the cask strength of 54.2% in 2003. Named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from. This limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.

NAME: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

NAME: Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Mini Set 3 X 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
Three Chivas Royal Salutes, in miniature Wade decanters. Ruby, Emerald and Sapphire.
All are 5cl x 40cl

NAME: Caol Ila - The Suspicion - Signature Vintage
DESCRIPTION: The Suspicion from over in Islay at Caol ila Disitllery, it has been bottled by Signatory Vintage in Pitlochry. It was distilled in 2013 and bottled in 2019 after it had matured in a hogshead cask at 46% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1966 (5cl)
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1966, this 18 year old has fully matured in sherry wood casks before being bottled. This is a 75cl bottling at 43% ABV. This bottling is now old and rare.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tube.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

NAME: Jameson - Signature Reserve 1L
DESCRIPTION:
Jameson has been distilling whiskey since 1780 but are always experimenting.
This is their signature reserve.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

NAME: Ballantine's - 17 Year Old (75cl)
DESCRIPTION: This Ballantine's 17-Year-Old bottling is from the 1990s.  Matured in oak casks and bottled by Ballantine & Son Limited distillers. This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with presentation tin tube.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: BOX - Dálvve - High Coast Spirit
DESCRIPTION: This single malt whisky was matured in Bourbon Casks with a perfect balance of peated and unpeated high coast spirit. Dálvve is made from The High Coast Spirit, manufactured and matured on the riverbanks of Ångermanälven, way up north in Scandinavia. Crafted by passion, perfected by nature during long bright summers and dark cold dálvvit.

NAME: Kilchoman - Autumn 2009 Release
DESCRIPTION:
10,000 bottles were produced of this Kilchoman Autumn 2009 release which was only the second release from the distillery.
3 years in bourbon casks and finished in Oloroso sherry casks. Just to top it off a 3 year old refill bourbon barrel was added to the vatting.

NAME: Glen Elgin - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Handcrafted in Speyside in pot stills, this 12 year old is a classic.
Glen Elgin is situated on the outskirts of the Royal Burgh of Elgin on the banks of the River Lossie.

NAME: Dewar's - 18 Year Old - Founders Reserve (75cl)
DESCRIPTION:
The 18-year-old release from the core Dewar's range blended from Old & Rare Highland, Speyside and Lowland Single Malt and Grain Whiskies. 
Bottle 01045.

NAME: Hakushu - Distiller's Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu Distiller's Reserve single malt whisky is a no-age-statement expression, that captures the smoky, herbaceous characteristics of their whiskies. This was one of two Spring 2014 release from Suntory.

NAME: Hakushu - Distiller's Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu Distiller's Reserve single malt whisky is a no-age-statement expression, that captures the smoky, herbaceous characteristics of their whiskies. This was one of two Spring 2014 release from Suntory.

NAME: Auchroisk - 10 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: In 2001, Flora and Fauna released this 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

NAME: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: Glenlivet - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old - Ardbone pack
DESCRIPTION:
This 70cl Ardbeg 10 Year Old comes in a unique bone-shaped presentation tin  to honour the distillery's mascot Shortie.
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

NAME: Highland Park - Voyage of the Raven
DESCRIPTION:
The Voyage of the Raven was released in 2017 and is a travel retail exclusive.
Most of the spirits time in a cask was spent maturing in first-fill sherry seasoned oak casks.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old - Ardbone pack
DESCRIPTION:
This 70cl Ardbeg 10 Year Old comes in a unique bone-shaped presentation tin  to honour the distillery's mascot Shortie.
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

NAME: Benromach - Cask Strength 2009 - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This 2009 vintage Benromach was bottled in 2019 after a decade maturing in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks. This delicately smoky dram is said to be replacing 100° Proof in the Bemromach Classic Range.

NAME: Jura - 10 Year Old - Legacy (1L)
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This is an older bottling from the Isle of Jura's only distillery. Jura 'Legacy' is a 10-year-old single malt. 1L.

NAME: Hakushu - Distiller's Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu Distiller's Reserve single malt whisky is a no-age-statement expression, that captures the smoky, herbaceous characteristics of their whiskies. This was one of two Spring 2014 release from Suntory.

NAME: Nikka - Whisky From The Barrel - 50cl
DESCRIPTION: Nikka From the Barrel is a blend from The Nikka Whisky Distilling Co.  Matured malt grain whiskies from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries have been blended and recasked.  The blend won the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards in 2007 and 2010.

NAME: Benromach - Peat Smoke 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Benromach Peat Smoke was distilled in 2009.
It's part of a small number of batches, that include peat, from the Speyside distillery.
47ppm of peat and notes of liquorice, orange or grapefruit.

NAME: Benromach - Château Cissac - 2010
DESCRIPTION: A 2010 vintage Benromach, released as part of Benromach's Wood Finish series. This single malt has been aged in first-fill bourbon then finished in Chateau Cissac wine casks from the Haut-Médoc region of Bordeaux. Bottled in 2018.

NAME: Haig's - Dimple '1890' 50cl
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: John Haig  Co Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - The Original (Gift Set)
DESCRIPTION: A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

NAME: Aberlour - Casg Annamh - Batch #1
DESCRIPTION: Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 1.

NAME: Kilkerran  - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an eagerly anticpiated first core product from Kilkerran – The Kilkerran 12 Year Old is lightly peated and non-chill filtered, and has been matured in a combination of 70% bourbon casks and 30% Sherry casks.  The distillery was reopened in 2004 after being closed for almost 80 years.

NAME: Robbie Burns - Old Scotch Whisky 1970s
DESCRIPTION: Robbie Burns Blend from the 1970s. A tribute to Robert Burns, 'combining the best of Scottish ingredients and skill wherever good company is found, Burns will be remembered and Scotch whisky will be enjoyed.'

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 16 Year Old - Hand Filled #300073 - Moine Bourbon (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: A 20cl hand fill from Bunnahabhain, this is a 16-Year-Old Moine Bourbon.  Bottled at 55.4% from cask No. 300073 in October 2019.

NAME: Dalmore - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

NAME: Dalmore - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

NAME: Auchroisk - 9 Year Old Lady of the Glen 2011
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in a Bourbon cask for over seven years, only 50 litres were drawn and transferred into a Pedro Ximenez Octave for Josafer Tanoaria for a finishing period. 
This dram was distilled on the 14th of April 2011 and bottled at cask strength on the 29th of May 2020.
Only 53 bottles were produced for this limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Experimental Series #2 - Project XX
DESCRIPTION: The second release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series is their Project XX expression.  Glenfiddich asked its 20 ambassadors to choose their favourite cask from the distillery's warehouses. Malt Master Brian Kinsman then married these casks created a new, experimental whisky – Project XX.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin with the 16 men of Tain.

NAME: Bell's - 8 Year Old - Millennium Malt
DESCRIPTION: A special Millennium decanter of 8-year-old blended whisky from Bell's bottled for the Millennium in 2000 consisting of single malt and grain whiskies.

NAME: Nikka Taketsuru - Pure Malt
DESCRIPTION: This is a non-age-statement expression of Nikka Taketsuru pure malt whisky, named after the company's founder, Masataka Taketsuru.  It contains a blend consisting of a high percentage of malt from Miyagikyo distillery, with the remainder coming from Yoichi, including some matured in sherry casks.

NAME: Bladnoch - 10 Year Old Limited Release Bourbon Expression
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of the first releases for Bladnoch distillery under new ownership, which happened in 2015. 
No added colour and non-chill-filtered this 10 Year Old has certainly got the Lowland feel about it.
Its a Bourbon expression that is a limited release and bottled at 46.7%.

NAME: Bowmore - 9 Year Old - Sherry Cask
DESCRIPTION: Bowmore 9 Year Old is a recent addition to their core range. Matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this is a limited release.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

NAME: SMWS - 10 Year Old Big Swirl Sherry Cask Blend Batch 7
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This is blended batch #7 and is made of only Sherry casks.It has a classic sherry profile.

NAME: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - Distillers Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is a 2012 edition of the Royal Lochnagar - Distillers Edition. It was double matured in fine old Muscat Cask-wood which brings a sweet floral richness to the spirit.
It was distilled in the year 2000 and bottled in the year 2012.
Batch RL/00-12W

NAME: Caol Ila - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
A lovely bottle of Caol Ila 12, said to be perfect entry point to the world of peaty whisky.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Ballantine's - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This Ballantine's 17-Year-Old bottling is from the 1990s.  Matured in oak casks and bottled by Ballantine & Son Limited distillers. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Ballantine's - Vitality
DESCRIPTION: Ballantine's Vitality, a plentiful, pure grain scotch whisky featuring a revitalising taste and distinctive aroma. The Ballantine Vitality Pure Grain bottle was released as part of the Ballantine's Sensation whiskies, as was the Ballantine Serenity.

NAME: Ballantine's - Serenity
DESCRIPTION: The Ballantine Serenity blended scotch whisky was released as part of the Ballantine's Sensation whiskies.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old -  Manzanilla Cask #3212 (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This limited release from Bunnahabhain is a 20cl bottling of Manzanilla cask matured single malt. Bottled in February 2020 at 54.2%. This 11-Year-Old, matured in warehouse 9 has rich flavours of nuts, fruits and toffee, with a salted caramel finish.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

NAME: Bowmore - Black Rock (1L)
DESCRIPTION: Bowmore Black Rock was released for the travel retail market in 2014. This is a no-age Statement whisky that was matured predominantly in Spanish ex-sherry casks, this shows an excellent balance between richness and smoke.

NAME: Bimber - 1st Release - The Perfect Measure (5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 5cl sample of Bimber - First Release.
One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Loyalty Of The Wolf
DESCRIPTION:
The 'Loyalty of the Wolf' by Highland Park is a 14-year-old single malt. This is a 1L bottling.
This bottle has been matured slowly in sherry-seasoned American oak and ex-bourbon casks at 42.3%.
'Loyalty of the Wolf' celebrates the determination, co-operation, and courage in a single malt. This whisky is both sweet and complex, displaying a fine balance of contrasts, just like the Vikings - and the wolves - themselves.

NAME: Laphroaig - Four Oak (1L)
DESCRIPTION: This Laphroaig has been matured in four different types of casks; virgin American oak barrels, European oak hogsheads, ex-bourbon barrels & small quarter casks. Originally released as a travel retail exclusive

NAME: Scapa - 2001 - Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2001
Bottled: 2014

NAME: Glenfiddich - The Original - Inspired by 1963
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition release from Glenfiddich. The Original is based on Hamish Robertson's 1963 Straight Malt recipe, considered by many to be the world's first single malt.  Presented in a bold premium black tin, this is a non-age statement single malt whisky bottled at 40% abv.

NAME: Kilchoman - Sanaig
DESCRIPTION:
This was made part of the core range at Kilchoman core range on the 7th March 2016.
The malt contained within has been matured for at least 4 years in both bourbon barrels and Oloroso sherry casks.
The percentage of which is shown on the front of the box with a small bar chart.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

NAME: Islay Mist - 12 Year Old - Feis Ile 2019
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macduff Glen Deveron Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
Islay Mist 12 Year Old - including Laphroaig Single Malt. Islay Mist retains the smoky flavour of Laphroaig whilst offering a beautiful softness.  This is one of just 75 bottles produced for Feis Ile 2019.
This is bottle number 62.

NAME: Peat Faerie - 7 Year Old - SMWS Batch #4
DESCRIPTION: Batch 4 was discovered when developing its predecessor. The Tasting Panel sampled a number of blended recipes at different proportions, strengths and ages and some of the younger blends were among the highest scoring. This 7-year old recipe is born from both barrels and hogsheads from Islay and Speyside, and features a stronger Islay influence than its older namesake. This is one of 2172 bottles.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old is an old-style bottling from Islay distillery. 
With milder tones, this would be an ideal introduction to the Islay malts.

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:

NAME: Tormore - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 12 year old single malt from the Speyside distillery, Tormore.  Launched in 2004 this is the distillery's main official bottling.  Tormore is part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio of distilleries.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: Benromach - Château Cissac - 2010
DESCRIPTION: A 2010 vintage Benromach, released as part of Benromach's Wood Finish series. This single malt has been aged in first-fill bourbon then finished in Chateau Cissac wine casks from the Haut-Médoc region of Bordeaux. Bottled in 2018.

NAME: Ballantines - 17 Year Old - Allied Distillers 25th July Special Edition
DESCRIPTION: Ballantine's 17 year old is said the be the price of the Master blender. A special whisky with a smooth taste and round finish.  This limited edition Allied Distiller's bottling was given to staff members when the company was sold to Chivas Brothers in 25th July 2005.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - The Original
DESCRIPTION: A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

NAME: Bacardi - Founder's Day 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This lot contains 3 x 100ml
This Bacardi premuim rum collection showcasing the 3 aged rums -

NAME: Kingsbarns - Dream to Dram (Limited Release)
DESCRIPTION: The Dream to Dram single malt Scotch whisky was Distilled in 2015.matured in first-fill ex-Bourbon casks from Heaven Hill Kentucky distillery and first-fill shaved, toasted and re-charred barriques.

NAME: Nikka - Whisky From The Barrel - 50cl
DESCRIPTION: Nikka From the Barrel is a blend from The Nikka Whisky Distilling Co.  Matured malt grain whiskies from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries have been blended and recasked.  The blend won the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards in 2007 and 2010.

NAME: Benromach - Organic - 2011
DESCRIPTION:
Benromach Organic was distilled in 2011 in Virgin American Oak Casks and then later bottled in 2019. 
Every step of the careful making of this whisky is Certified Organic, this whisky also meets the rigorous UK Soil Association standards regarding growing the ingredients, distillation, maturing and bottling.

NAME: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: John Haig  Co Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This is a Litre bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

NAME: Benromach - Peat Smoke 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Benromach Peat Smoke was distilled in 2009.
It's part of a small number of batches, that include peat, from the Speyside distillery.
47ppm of peat and notes of liquorice, orange or grapefruit.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - Spirit of the Open
DESCRIPTION: This is bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, was released after it was rebranded as The Original in the relaunch of the core range in 2007.  This edition was bottled for 'The Spirit of the Open' for the 144th St. Andrews Open golf championship.

NAME: Benromach - Organic - 2011
DESCRIPTION:
Benromach Organic was distilled in 2011 in Virgin American Oak Casks and then later bottled in 2019. 
Every step of the careful making of this whisky is Certified Organic, this whisky also meets the rigorous UK Soil Association standards regarding growing the ingredients, distillation, maturing and bottling.

NAME: Deanston - Dragon’s Milk Stout Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: Deanston Stout Cask Finish uses barrels from Dragon’s Milk, a stout beer from the New Holland Brewing Company in Michigan which uses bourbon barrels for maturation. These are then passed on to Deanston for a six-month finish. Bottled at 50.5% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.

NAME: Glenkinchie - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old is an older style bottling from Glenkinchie Distillery, that comes presented in the famous orange box - with the classic malt stamp on the front of the box. The Glenkinchie 10 year old has since been replaced by the 12 year old.

NAME: Peat Faerie - 7 Year Old - SMWS Batch #4
DESCRIPTION: Batch 4 was discovered when developing its predecessor. The Tasting Panel sampled a number of blended recipes at different proportions, strengths and ages and some of the younger blends were among the highest scoring. This 7-year old recipe is born from both barrels and hogsheads from Islay and Speyside, and features a stronger Islay influence than its older namesake. This is one of 2172 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg - Ten & Blasda (Limited Release) 2 x 5cl Gift Set
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'
Comes with a 5cl of the Ardbeg 10 Year Old. 
Ardbeg 10: 5cl @ 46% ABV
Blasda: 5cl @40% ABV

NAME: Bimber - Da Hong Pao Tea Gin
DESCRIPTION: Da Hong Pao Tea Gin is an earthy, floral, richly coloured gin made with one of the world most expensive teas and expertly handcrafted at Bimber Distillery in London. Prized by tea connoisseurs worldwide, Da Hong Pao grows between the rocks of Southern China's breathtaking Wuyi Mountains.

NAME: Dalmunach - 3 Year Old - 2016 - The Octave Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Duncan Taylor Series this 3 year old bottle of Dulmunach was distilled in 20016 and bottled in 2020 from cask #10825759 in the Speyside region of Scotland where 108 bottles were produced. This bottling spent 3 years in oak casks and 9 months in Octave.
This is bottle number 37.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Pure Malt 1980's
DESCRIPTION: Released to celebrate the distilleries Centenary in 1987, this rare bottle Glenfiddich Pure Malt is becoming increasingly hard to find.  It includes a limited edition print.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin with the 16 men of Tain.

NAME: Auchroisk - 10 Year Old 2009 - Douglas Laing  - UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A UK exclusive from independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This Authroisk 10 Year Old Exclusively Bottled for UK Emporiums.  Distilled in March 2009 and bottled May 2019 at the natural Cask Strength of 62.1%, without colouring and chill-filtration.  One of 216 bottles charged from Refill Hogshead DL1335.
One of the most respected and highly acclaimed independent bottlers of Scotch Whisky, Douglas Laing & Co has been established since 1948. The company is based in Glasgow and boasts a great selection of brands including its "Remarkable Regional Malts" range, encompassing The Epicurean, Timorous Beastie, Scallywag, Rock Island and Big Peat, as well as Old Particular, Provenance and Xtra Old Particular, which they collectively call their "Exceptional Single Casks".

NAME: Highland Park - Magnus US Exclusive (5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Magnus single malt whisky was matured in Sherry seasoned American oak casks. The release was named after Magnus Eunson, Highland Park Founder who was a direct descendant of the Vikings that settled on Orkney hundreds of years ago. 
This lot contains 1 x 5cl miniature bottle of Highland Park Magnus.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - PX #1635 Hand Filled (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This 20cl Hand Filled single cask bottling from Bunnahabhain distillery is a 12-year-old, matured in PX cask #1635 in warehouse 9.  It was bottled in 2018 at the cask strength of 60.4%.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 8 Year Old - Pure Malt (1970s)
DESCRIPTION: A now rare 75cl bottling of 1970s Glenfiddich 8 Year Old Pure Malt.

NAME: Highland Park - Viking Tribe
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2018, this new release from Highland Park was originally only available through Amazon UK. 
"Viking Tribe" is now part of the core Highland Park range. 
This single malt was released as a celebration of the togetherness shown by the Vikings.

NAME: Highland Park - Svein - 1 Litre
DESCRIPTION: Svein comes from Highland Park's Warrior series, which was released for the travel retail market.  This bottling is named after a legendary Viking chieftain Svien Asleifsson who's daring exploits lie at the heart of the stirring Orkneyinga Saga.  It is said he is known for being charismatic, ruthless and a fearsome warrior with boundless hospitality.  The whisky is matured predominately in sherry seasoned ex-American oak casks creating notes of crème brûlée, and gentle peat smoke.

NAME: Highland Park - Viking Tribe
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2018, this new release from Highland Park was originally only available through Amazon UK. 
"Viking Tribe" is now part of the core Highland Park range. 
This single malt was released as a celebration of the togetherness shown by the Vikings.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 10 Year Old - Hand Filled #3201 - Manzanilla (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: A 20cl hand fill from Bunnahabhain, 10-Year-Old Manzanilla.  Bottled at 55.1% from cask No. 3201 in October 2019.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 10 Year Old - Hand Filled #3201 - Manzanilla (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: A 20cl hand fill from Bunnahabhain, 10-Year-Old Manzanilla.  Bottled at 55.1% from cask No. 3201 in October 2019.

NAME: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - PX #1635 Hand Filled (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This 20cl Hand Filled single cask bottling from Bunnahabhain distillery is a 12-year-old, matured in PX cask #1635 in warehouse 9.  It was bottled in 2018 at the cask strength of 60.4%.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 6 Year Old - Islay Barley 2011
DESCRIPTION: The 2011 Bruichladdich Islay Barley was made with Publican and Oxbridge barley grown by 6 farms ion Islay.  It was aged for 6 years in a combination of casks:

NAME: Auchroisk - 10 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: In 2001, Flora and Fauna released this 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

NAME: Speyside - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A smooth Speyside 12-year-old single malt bottled by The Speyside Distillery.

NAME: Wolfburn - Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: This Wolfburn Single Malt is a 3 year old whisky that has been matured in ex-peated quarter casks from Islay and is a gently peated whisky.  The inaugural whisky was launched globally in March 2016 and has won three gold medal awards in international competitions.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: Glenlivet - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers. Aged only in Oak Casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

NAME: Miltonduff - 12 Year Old (75cl)
DESCRIPTION: An old Miltonduff 12 year old, discontinued quite a long time ago. It was a key component in Ballantine's whisky.

NAME: Triumph - Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
A special bottling of malt whiskies from 27 of Diageo's distilleries.  This blend was been produced to commemorate the opening of Diageo's 28th distillery, Roseisle. Roseisle Distillery was officially opened on October 11th 2010.
 
This is bottle number 1429.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 16 Year Old - Hand Filled #300073 - Moine Bourbon (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: A 20cl hand fill from Bunnahabhain, this is a 16-Year-Old Moine Bourbon.  Bottled at 55.4% from cask No. 300073 in October 2019.

NAME: Berry Bros & Rudd - Sherry Cask Blended Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
Berry Bros has a history that is pretty spectacular...it has two royal warrants and 300+ years of history. Still trading from its original base and home - No3 St James Street London.
From Berry themself...
"Sherry casks are considered a luxury in Whisky making. These expensive barrels imbue a spirit with distinctive notes of deep fruit, citrus and nuts. Our Classic Sherry Cask Malt is blended from the best Sherry butts to deliver a balanced expression of this uniquely engaging style."

NAME: Tomatin - Metal - Five Virtues - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Stright from the Highlands, this Tomatin was matured in first-fill bourbon barrels. 
It forms part of the Five Virtues Series.

NAME: Tomatin - Earth - Five Virtue Series
DESCRIPTION:
Tomatin Earth is one part of the five part series from the Highland Distillery.
The other 4 parts include -
Water, Fire, Wood and Metal.
This is a peated whisky and was matured in refill oak hogshead casks.

NAME: Tomatin - 2008 - Selected Single Cask Bottling - Master of Malt Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in a first fill bourbon cask #79 this bottle was distilled on 16th January 2008 before being bottled exclusively for Master of Malt on 9th September 2019 at 60% ABV. There is only 234 bottles. 
 
This is bottle number 110.

NAME: Gordon & MacPhail - Minis (6 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 6 x 5cl:

NAME: Chita - Distillers Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Japanese single grain whisky from the Chita distillery, owned by Suntory. This is their main expression - a whisky matured in a combination of Sherry, bourbon and wine casks.

NAME: Deerstalker - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This bottle is from an undisclosed distillery, it is a 12 year old Highland malt which was released under the Deerstalker brand.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 8 Year Old -  The Laddie Eight
DESCRIPTION: This was one of first releases of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement and this is the 8 year old bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

NAME: Oban - 14 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

NAME: Kilchoman - Machir Bay (& 2 Glasses)
DESCRIPTION:
Kilchoman's Machir Bay matured in ex-bourbon barrels and Oloroso Sherry butts.
Possibly one of the lesser-known of the Islay malts but a real must try if you haven't already!
This gift set also includes 2 x glasses.

NAME: Fallen Vodka
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie’s vodka brand, Fallen, was endorsed by Virgin. This quirky vodka brand concentrates on communicating a sense of product purity. Fallen ironically celebrates the idea of imperfection - 'there's more soul in imperfection.'

NAME: Fallen Vodka
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie’s vodka brand, Fallen, was endorsed by Virgin. This quirky vodka brand concentrates on communicating a sense of product purity. Fallen ironically celebrates the idea of imperfection - 'there's more soul in imperfection.'

NAME: Peaky Blinder - Bourbon Whisky
DESCRIPTION: The Peaky Blinder range now features a bourbon whiskey, matured in American Oak. This is a flavourful and good value bourbon produced in Indiana for the Peaky Blinder range by Sadler's.

NAME: Auchroisk - 10 Year Old 2009 - Douglas Laing  - UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A UK exclusive from independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This Authroisk 10 Year Old Exclusively Bottled for UK Emporiums.  Distilled in March 2009 and bottled May 2019 at the natural Cask Strength of 62.1%, without colouring and chill-filtration.  One of 216 bottles charged from Refill Hogshead DL1335.
